snippet: The European Union will never manage to compete with China and other rising powers unless it unites politically, scales up and becomes a genuine giant.
abstract: Op-Ed article by European studies Prof Timothy Garton Ash examines why Europeans have not shown the political will to save the euro zone by moving toward a closer fiscal and political union; contends that the only way in which the European Union can compete with China and other rising powers, as well as with the United States, is if it unites politically scales up and becomes a true global giant.
lead_paragraph: The European Union will never manage to compete with China and other rising powers unless it unites politically, scales up and becomes a genuine giant.

headline.main: Can Europe Survive the Rise of the Rest?
headline.print_headline: Can Europe Survive The Rise of the Rest?
